SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

becker.io
Class TextInput

java.lang.Object
  becker.io.TextInput
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConsoleInput
public class TextInput
extends Object

A TextInput object may be used to easily read text from an input stream.

For most primitive types (char, int, long, double) as well as strings there are a pair of queries. The first is query XIsAvailable() where X is the name of the type (char, int, string, etc.). The predicate returns true if a value of the given type may be read from the input without error. If reading from a keyboard, the user will be asked for the value when XIsAvailable() executes.

The second query is readX where X is defined as above. When readX is executed it will either

  • read the next token from the input stream and return it, provided it is of type X.
  • otherwise, it will raise IOError exception. This is an unchecked exception so the class may be used by programmers who do not know how to catch exceptions.

Some examples will elaborate. Assume that X is int. The "Initial Situation" shows the characters on the input stream. The symbol • shows how far input has been read; we'll call this the file cursor. That is, characters to the left of the file cursor have been read; those on the right have not. An underscore stands for whitespace such as tabs and spaces. A newline is indicated by ¬.

Initial SituationCalling this method Results inFinal Situation
•_ _ 123 _ intIsAvailable() true •_ _ 123 _
• _ one _ intIsAvailable() false •_ _ one _
•123 intIsAvailable() true •123
•¬ intIsAvailable() false •¬
•_ _ 123 _ readInt() 123 _ _ 123• _
•_ _ 123AB readInt() 123 _ _ 123•AB
• _ one _ readInt() IOError thrown

Author:
Byron Weber Becker

Constructor Detail

TextInput

public TextInput()
Create a new TextInput object which reads from the console (System.in).

TextInput

public TextInput(String fileName)
Create a new TextInput object that reads from the named file or URL. If the name supplied to fileName begins with "http:" it is taken as a URL, otherwise as the name of a file.

Parameters:
fileName - The name of the file or URL to read.

TextInput

public TextInput(Reader reader)
Create a new TextInput object that reads from the given reader.

Parameters:
reader - The reader to read.
Method Detail

getFilename

public String getFilename()
Get the filename used to open this file.

Returns:
the name of the file if TextInput(String fileName) constructor was used; the empty string otherwise.

close

public void close()
Close the file.

eolIsAvailable

public boolean eolIsAvailable()
Determine whether the file cursor is at the end of the line. The end of line is determined by a carriage return ('\r'), line feed ('\n') or a carriage return followed immediately by a line feed.

Returns:
true if the file cursor is at the end of the line, false otherwise

eofIsAvailable

public boolean eofIsAvailable()
Determine whether the cursor is at the end of the file.

Returns:
true if the cursor is at the end of the file, false otherwise

lineNumber

public int lineNumber()
Deprecated. 2002-Oct-10 Replaced by getLineNumber().

getLineNumber

public int getLineNumber()
Get the line number of the line currently being read. Line numbers begin at 0 and increase by 1 each time '\n', '\r' or '\r' '\n' is read.

Returns:
The line number

charIsAvailable

public boolean charIsAvailable()
Determine whether at least one character remains before the end of the file. If reading from the console, this method may block while waiting for input from the user.

Returns:
true if there is a character available, false otherwise.

charIsAvailable

public boolean charIsAvailable(char ch)
Determine whether the given character is the next available character.

Parameters:
ch - The character to check for
Returns:
true if the next character is the same as ch; false otherwise.

getChar

public char getChar()
             throws IOError
Deprecated. 2002-Oct-10 Replaced by readChar().

Throws:
IOError

readChar

public char readChar()
              throws IOError
Get the next available character from the current line of input. This method will read across line boundaries. Throws IOError if the cursor is already at the end of the file.

Returns:
The next available character.
Throws:
IOError

intIsAvailable

public boolean intIsAvailable()
Determine whether the next available token before the end of the line or the end of the file is an integer. If reading from the console, this method may block while waiting for input from the user. The method skips over spaces and tabs and then reads digits until the first non-digit is found.

Returns:
true if there is a integer available, false otherwise.

getInt

public int getInt()
           throws IOError
Deprecated. 2002-Oct-10 Replaced by readInt().

Throws:
IOError

readInt

public int readInt()
            throws IOError
Read the next available integer from the current line of input. The method skips over leading spaces and tabs and then reads digits until the first non-digit is found.

Returns:
The next available integer.
Throws:
IOError - if no integer is available.

doubleIsAvailable

public boolean doubleIsAvailable()
Determine whether the next available token before the end of the line or the end of the file is a double. If reading from the console, this method may block while waiting for input from the user.

Returns:
true if there is a double available, false otherwise.

getDouble

public double getDouble()
                 throws IOError
Deprecated. 2002-Oct-10 Replaced by readDouble().

Throws:
IOError

readDouble

public double readDouble()
                  throws IOError
Read the next available double from the current line of input. Throws IOError if no such double is available.

Returns:
The next available double.
Throws:
IOError - if no double is available.

booleanIsAvailable

public boolean booleanIsAvailable()
Determine whether the next available token before the end of the line or the end of the file is a boolean (one of {"true", "false"}) If reading from the console, this method may block while waiting for input from the user.

Returns:
true if there is a boolean available, false otherwise.

getBoolean

public boolean getBoolean()
                   throws IOError
Deprecated. 2002-Oct-10 Replaced by readBoolean().

Throws:
IOError

readBoolean

public boolean readBoolean()
                    throws IOError
Read the next available boolean value (one of {"true", "false"}) from the current line of input. Throws IOError if no boolean is available.

Returns:
The next available boolean.
Throws:
IOError - if no boolean value is available.

skipSpaces

public void skipSpaces()
Skip over spaces and tabs, placing the cursor just before the next character that is not a space or a tab.

wordIsAvailable

public boolean wordIsAvailable()
Deprecated. As of 26-May-2003 due to confusion over the meaning of "word". Replaced with the more accurately named tokenIsAvailable().

Determine whether a word remains before the next end of line character or before the end of the file. A word consists of non-whitespace characters up to but not including any following whitespace. Leading whitespace is skipped. If reading from the console, this method may block while waiting for input from the user.

Returns:
true if there is a word available, false otherwise.

tokenIsAvailable

public boolean tokenIsAvailable()
Determine whether a token remains before the next end of line character or before the end of the file. A token consists of non-whitespace characters up to but not including any following whitespace. Leading whitespace is skipped. If reading from the console, this method may block while waiting for input from the user.

Returns:
true if there is a token available, false otherwise.

getWord

public String getWord()
               throws IOError
Deprecated. 2002-Oct-10 Replaced by readToken().

Throws:
IOError

readWord

public String readWord()
                throws IOError
Deprecated. As of 26-May-2003 due to confusion over the meaning of "word". Replaced with the more accurately named readToken().

Read the next available word from the current line of input. Leading whitespace is skipped. The word consists of all the characters up to but not including the next whitespace.

Returns:
The next word on the input.
Throws:
IOError - if no such word is available.

readToken

public String readToken()
                 throws IOError
Read the next available token from the current line of input. Leading whitespace is skipped. The token consists of all the characters up to but not including the next whitespace.

Returns:
The next token on the input.
Throws:
IOError - if no such token is available.

getLine

public String getLine()
               throws IOError
Deprecated. 2002-Oct-10 Replaced by readLine().

Throws:
IOError

readLine

public String readLine()
                throws IOError
Read the rest of the line from the input, including the end-of-line character(s), advancing to the next line of input. Does not return any tabs and spaces at the beginning of the line.

Returns:
the entire string except for the end-of-line character(s).
Throws:
IOError - if the file cursor is already at the end of the file.
